head.supplied: 26/9/90 ¶ ¶ […] ¶ ¶ I think it unnecessary to send bark material to Baron [von] Mueller, for we are quite capable of dealing with it here, and will give it more attention than he especially as he i...

div.p: MRS 15/1, Letterbook, Collector, 1890-1920, p. 71, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney

I think it unnecessary to send bark material to Baron [von] Mueller, for we are quite capable of dealing with it here, and will give it more attention than he especially as he is incessantly complaining that he has more work than he can get through. Except, therefore, [if] he asks you direct for any particular material, I think it best that you forward herbarium specimens through me in future. If I cannot settle the matter here, I can then forward the specimens on to Baron [von] Mueller, and if there is any chance of an officer of the Technological Museum discovering a new species in future, I do not see why the Technological Museum should not get the full credit of it, and I, as botanist to my department, consulted in the matter

I do not wish to make what I have said retrospective , as I am quite aware you have botanical questions pending with the Baron long before you accepted permanent employment under the Dept. of Public Instruction (Technical Education Branch). […]
